text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with barbecued peaches and no not
truly barbecued basically grilled with
barbecue sauce this is a great way to
use up those coals after you've already
cooked your meat and you want to do a
cool little quick side dish this is
perfect so i'm gonna start with two ripe
freestone peaches okay now there's
clingstone and there's free stone and
how you know you have the right one if I
cut around and twist that pit that stone
will come right out the other kind don't
work for stuff like this so make sure
when you're in the market you're buying
peaches that the stone is going to come
out easily all right make sure the
produce guy or woman let you know which
variety you're looking for so once there
have and the stones are removed I'm
going to score them about a half-inch
deep in the center with my paring knife
so just two cuts one way two cuts the
other that's going to help them cook
evenly and help the sauce get down into
the peach and speaking of sauce that's
the last step I'm going to drizzle the
peaches with my favorite barbecue sauce
and if you want to know what that is you
can check out the blog post but any
sauce is going to work here then you're
going to take a spoon or brush and just
spread it evenly
making sure it's getting down into those
slashes we made all right and then we're
heading out to the grill where we've
already used the grill we've already
cooked some delicious meat or meat like
products we're ready to eat pretty much
we're letting the meat rest we got about
ten minutes let's do these peaches so
I'm going to put those skin side down
over the coals and we're just going to
wait and what we're looking for is tiny
bubbles in the center of the peach okay
you can kind of see it there it's not
super easy to see but if you look
carefully every once in a while you'll
see a little bubble come up and that's
the heat transferring through the peach
up through those little cut marks okay
now as soon as you see that bubbling
like that you're pretty much done you're
also going to be able to tell when you
go to grab these with your tongs they're
just a little bit softer than when you
put them on okay they're not mushy
but there's
definitely a little bit of give to them
that should be heated all the way
through and you're ready to serve what
do you serve this with so many things I
had this amazing brined pork chop with a
Carolina mustard barbecue sauce that I'm
going to show you in a future video
and I paired this peach with that and it
was magnificent now if you're worried
about any kind of charred skin left over
from the grill you can see there I just
pulled that right off it just peels
right off and that was such an amazing
combination just beautiful so like I
said you've already grilled something
delicious you're letting the meat rest
it's the middle of summer you got some
beautiful ripe peaches throw them on the
grill why not so anyway I hope you give
that a try all the ingredients are on

and heat but you know what go check out
